level.text: CFSA may modify a license at any point during the licensing year upon request by the independent living program or on CFSA’s own authority, provided that the modification is not deleterious to the residents’ health, safety, or welfare.
A request for a modification made by an independent living program shall be made to CFSA, and shall:
Be in writing, using a form provided by CFSA;
Set forth all relevant information concerning the specific modification sought and the reason for seeking the modification;
Contain any additional information required by CFSA; and
Be accompanied by all relevant documentation and information.
CFSA shall review a request for a license modification and either grant or deny the request within sixty (60) days of receipt of the completed request.
CFSA shall notify an applicant in writing of the decision to grant or deny a license modification. The notice shall include:
A statement of the grounds for the decision; and
An explanation of the right to and the method of requesting a fair hearing.
If CFSA decides to grant the license modification, it shall issue the modified license within two (2) business days of its decision.
